title: Current Conditions : 31.8F / -0.1C, Light Snow - 5:26 PM CST Mar. 1
text: Issued: 7:17 AM CST Mar. 1, 2017 – National Weather Service The Flood Warning continues for the Thorn creek at Thornton.* Until late tonight.* At 630 am Wednesday the stage was 10.1 feet.* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast... the river will continue rising to near 10.5 feet by this afternoon. The river will fall below flood stage this evening.Lat... Lon 4154 8767 4151 8760 4158 8754 4161 8760 Special Statement Issued: 5:14 PM EST Mar. 1, 2017 – National Weather Service ... Gusty winds and occasional snow showers through early evening to reduce visibility and possibly create difficult travel... West to northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts between 35 and45 mph will occur through early evening across northeast Illinoisand Northwest Indiana. High profile vehicles like semi- trucks traveling on north-south roads may find driving difficult. These winds may combine with falling snow to quickly though briefly reduce visibility. These gusty winds can also blow and move loose objects such as lawn furniture. Winds will gradually decrease during the evening. 414 PM CST Wed Mar 1 2017 /514 PM EST Wed Mar 1 2017/...
